option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"D:/Practikum/New":"{\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/ic_pm191_background.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android vector drawable XML file, which defines a vector image that can be used as an app icon or other graphical element in an Android app. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the visual elements of the vector image.\\n\\nThe file defines a vector drawable with a size of 108dp by 108dp, and a viewport size of 108 by 108. The drawable consists of a green background with a grid of white lines overlaid on it. The grid is created using a series of horizontal and vertical paths, with each path having a stroke width of 0.8dp and a stroke color of `#33FFFFFF`.\\n\\nThe file also includes a group element that scales the drawable to a size of 0 and then translates it to the center of the viewport, effectively centering the drawable within the 108dp by 108dp space.\",\"/app/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml\":\"This file is an Android manifest file that defines the structure and configuration of an Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather specifies the following:\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity of the application, which is the entry point for the app.\\n`SettingsActivity`: An activity that handles the application\\u0027s settings.\\n`SearchActivity`: An activity that handles the search functionality of the application.\\n`MediaActivity`: An activity that handles the media-related functionality of the application.\\n\\nThe manifest also declares the necessary permissions for the application to access the network and internet, and sets various application-level properties such as the app\\u0027s name, icon, and theme.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/ic_launcher_foreground.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android vector drawable resource file. It defines a vector graphic that can be used as an app icon or other visual asset in an Android application. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the vector path and gradient fill for the graphic.\\n\\nThe vector graphic appears to depict a stylized Android logo, with a gradient background and a white foreground shape. The file also includes some additional paths that define the shape of the logo and its surrounding elements.\",\"/app/src/main/res/color/switch_thumb_color.xml\":\"This file is an Android XML resource file that defines a color selector for a checked/unchecked state. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines two color values to be used in the application\\u0027s user interface.\\n\\nThe file specifies that when the view is in a checked state, the color should be `#FF3772E7`, and when it is in an unchecked state, the color should be `#FFAEAFB4`.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/activity_search.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file that defines the user interface for a search screen. It includes the following elements:\\n\\n`LinearLayout`: The main container for the layout, with a vertical orientation.\\n`MaterialToolbar`: The top toolbar with a navigation icon and a title.\\n`LinearLayout`: A container for the search input field and the clear text icon.\\n`EditText`: The search input field.\\n`ImageView`: The clear text icon.\\n`ProgressBar`: A loading indicator that is hidden by default.\\n`RecyclerView`: A list view for displaying search results.\\n`ConstraintLayout`: A container for the error message and retry button, which are hidden by default.\\n`ImageView`: The error image.\\n`TextView`: The error message.\\n`Button`: The retry button.\\n\\nThe file sets up the layout and appearance of the search screen, including the search input field, search results list, and error handling functionality.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/practicum/playlistmaker/SearchActivity.kt\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `SearchActivity` class, which is responsible for handling the search functionality in a music playlist application.\\n\\n`SearchActivity`: This class represents the search screen of the application, allowing users to search for music tracks and display the results.\\n\\n`clearInputText()`: This function clears the input text field and updates the track adapter with an empty list.\\n\\n`performSearch(query: String, append: Boolean \\u003d false)`: This function performs a search for the given query, handling network availability, loading state, and displaying the search results.\\n\\n`isNetworkAvailable()`: This function checks if the device has an active internet connection.\\n\\n`showError(message: String, imageRes: Int, showRetryButton: Boolean \\u003d false)`: This function displays an error message and an error image, with an optional retry button.\\n\\n`hideError()`: This function hides the error message and image.\\n\\n`showLoading(isLoading: Boolean)`: This function shows or hides the loading indicator.\\n\\n`showNetworkError()`: This function displays a network error message.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/ic_share.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an Android vector drawable resource that defines a path for an icon. The icon represents a share button or action, with a path that appears to be a curved arrow pointing upwards. The vector drawable can be used in Android applications to display this icon.\",\"/app/src/main/res/values/dimen.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an XML resource file that defines various dimensions (sizes, margins, paddings, etc.) for UI elements in an Android application. These dimensions can be used throughout the application to ensure consistent layout and styling. The dimensions defined in this file include text sizes, button sizes and spacing, layout paddings and margins, and image sizes.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/track_item.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file that defines the user interface for a track item in a music player or similar application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the visual elements and their layout within the view.\\n\\nHere\\u0027s a summary of the key elements in the file:\\n\\n`LinearLayout`: The main container that holds the entire track item layout.\\n\\n`ShapeableImageView`: Displays the album artwork or track cover image with rounded corners.\\n\\n`TextView`: Displays the track name, artist name, and track duration.\\n\\n`ImageView`: Displays an arrow icon to indicate that the track item is clickable or can be expanded.\\n\\nThe overall purpose of this file is to provide a consistent and visually appealing layout for displaying information about a single music track within a larger list or grid of tracks.\",\"/app/src/main/res/xml/backup_rules.xml\":\"This file is an XML document that provides a sample backup rules file for Android applications. It is used to configure the automatic backup feature in Android, which allows users to restore their app data and settings on a new device.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it provides a set of comments and example configurations for the `\\u003cfull-backup-content\\u003e` element, which is used to specify the data that should be included or excluded from the backup.\\n\\nThe main purpose of this file is to serve as a template for developers to customize the backup rules for their Android applications, ensuring that the necessary data is backed up and can be restored when needed.\",\"/app/src/main/res/mipmap-anydpi-v26/ic_pm191_round.xml\":\"This file appears to be an XML configuration file for an Android Adaptive Icon. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the foreground image to be used for the adaptive icon.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Specifies the XML version and encoding.\\n2. Defines an `\\u003cadaptive-icon\\u003e` element, which is a container for the adaptive icon configuration.\\n3. Within the `\\u003cadaptive-icon\\u003e` element, it specifies the `\\u003cforeground\\u003e` image to be used, which is located at the `@mipmap/ic_pm191_foreground` resource.\",\"/app/src/main/res/values/themes.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an Android resource file that defines the base application theme for the \\\"PlaylistMaker\\\" app. The theme is based on the Material Design 3 \\\"DayNight.NoActionBar\\\" theme and includes various color and background settings for the app\\u0027s user interface.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle configuration file for an Android project called \\\"Playlist Maker\\\". It sets up the plugin management and dependency resolution for the project, and defines the root project name and the included modules.\\n\\n`pluginManagement`: Configures the repositories for plugin management, including Google, Maven Central, and the Gradle Plugin Portal.\\n\\n`dependencyResolutionManagement`: Configures the repositories for dependency resolution, including Google and Maven Central, and sets the repositories mode to fail on project repositories.\\n\\n`rootProject.name`: Sets the name of the root project to \\\"Playlist Maker\\\".\\n\\n`include(\\\":app\\\")`: Includes the \\\":app\\\" module in the project.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/ac_unit_snow.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an Android vector drawable resource that defines a path for a vector image. The path represents a complex shape with various lines, curves, and angles, and the `fillColor` attribute specifies the color of the shape as `#D3E2F1`.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/arrow_back_light_mode.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an Android vector drawable resource that defines a vector image of an arrow pointing to the left. The vector image has a width and height of 24 dp, and a viewport size of 24x24. The path data defines the shape of the arrow, and the `fillColor` attribute sets the color of the arrow to the `colorOnSecondary` attribute from the app\\u0027s theme.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/ic_launcher_background.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android vector drawable XML file, which defines a vector image that can be used as an app icon or other graphical element in an Android app. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines a set of paths and lines that make up the vector image.\\n\\nThe file defines a 108x108 dp vector image with a green background and a grid of white lines. The grid lines are defined using a series of `\\u003cpath\\u003e` elements, each of which specifies the start and end points of a line segment, as well as the stroke width and color.\\n\\nOverall, this file provides a vector-based representation of a simple grid-like design that can be used as an app icon or other graphical element in an Android app.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/light_mode.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an Android vector drawable resource that defines a search icon. The vector drawable has a path that represents the shape of the search icon, including a magnifying glass and a search box. The drawable can be used in Android applications to display a search icon.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/practicum/playlistmaker/TrackAdapter.kt\":\"`TrackAdapter`: An adapter class that manages the display of a list of tracks in a RecyclerView.\\n\\n`getTracks()`: Returns the list of tracks managed by the adapter.\\n\\n`updateTracks(newTracks: List\\u003cTrack\\u003e)`: Updates the list of tracks managed by the adapter.\\n\\n`onCreateViewHolder(parent: ViewGroup, viewType: Int)`: Creates a new `TrackViewHolder` instance for each item in the list.\\n\\n`onBindViewHolder(holder: TrackViewHolder, position: Int)`: Binds the data of a specific track to the corresponding `TrackViewHolder`.\\n\\n`getItemCount()`: Returns the number of tracks in the list.\\n\\n`TrackViewHolder`: A ViewHolder class that holds the views for a single track item in the list.\\n\\n`bind(track: Track)`: Binds the data of a specific track to the views in the `TrackViewHolder`.\\n\\n`isNetworkAvailable(context: Context)`: Checks if the device has an active network connection.\\n\\nThis file contains an adapter class (`TrackAdapter`) that is responsible for managing the display of a list of tracks in a RecyclerView. The adapter handles tasks such as creating and binding ViewHolders, updating the list of tracks, and checking the network connectivity to load track artwork.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/ic_no_connection.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android vector drawable file, which defines a vector-based image that can be used in Android applications. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the visual elements of the image using various path and color definitions. The image appears to be a logo or icon with a stylized \\\"A\\\" shape and various other geometric elements.\",\"/app/src/main/res/values/colors.xml\":\"This file is an XML resource file that defines various color values for an Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions. The file provides a centralized location for defining color values that can be used throughout the application, such as background colors, text colors, and icon colors. This allows for easy management and consistency of the application\\u0027s visual styling.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/ic_find.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an Android vector drawable resource that defines a search icon. The vector drawable has a path that represents the shape of the search icon, including a magnifying glass and a search field. The drawable has a width and height of 14 dp and a viewport width and height of 14. The path is filled with a color of `#AEAFB4`.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/media.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android vector drawable resource, which is a vector-based image format used in Android applications. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines a vector graphic that can be used as an image asset in the application.\\n\\nThe vector graphic represents a document icon, with a rectangular shape and a document-like symbol inside. The icon is designed to be 21 pixels wide and 20 pixels tall, with a viewport size of 21 by 20 pixels. The path data defines the shape and color of the icon, which is filled with a dark gray color.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/place_holder_background.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android vector drawable XML file, which defines a vector image that can be used as an app icon or other graphical element in an Android app. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines a vector graphic with various paths and lines.\\n\\nThe file defines a 108x108 dp vector image with a green background and a grid of white lines. The grid is created using multiple `\\u003cpath\\u003e` elements, each defining a line segment. The overall effect is a simple, minimalist grid-like design that could be used as an app icon or other visual element.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/practicum/playlistmaker/Track.kt\":\"`Track`: A data class that represents a music track, containing information such as the track name, artist name, track duration, and artwork URL.\\n\\n`trackTime`: A computed property that returns the track duration in a formatted string (minutes:seconds).\\n\\nThis file defines a `Track` data class that encapsulates the essential information about a music track, including its name, artist, duration, and artwork URL. The `trackTime` property is a computed property that converts the track duration in milliseconds to a formatted string in the format of minutes and seconds.\",\"/app/src/main/res/mipmap-anydpi-v26/ic_pm191.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an XML file that defines an adaptive icon for an Android application. The adaptive icon is composed of a background image (`ic_pm191_background`) and a foreground image (`ic_pm191_foreground`). This file is used to specify the appearance of the application\\u0027s icon on the device\\u0027s home screen or app drawer.\",\"/app/src/main/res/values/strings.xml\":\"This file appears to be an XML resource file that contains various string resources used in an Android application called \\\"Playlist Maker\\\". The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines various strings that can be used throughout the application, such as button labels, error messages, and other user-facing text. The strings are organized into different categories, such as \\\"find_button\\\", \\\"btn_media\\\", \\\"btn_settings\\\", and so on, which likely correspond to different parts of the application\\u0027s user interface.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/cursor.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an XML file that defines the appearance of a cursor in an Android application. The file specifies the width and color of the cursor, which can be used in the application\\u0027s user interface.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/cursor_color.xml\":\"This file is an Android XML resource file that defines a drawable selector. It specifies that the drawable resource named \\\"cursor\\\" should be used as the drawable for this selector.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any classes or functions. It is a configuration file that is used by the Android framework to define the appearance of a UI element, in this case, a cursor.\",\"/app/src/main/res/color/switch_track_color.xml\":\"This file is an Android XML resource file that defines a color selector for a checked/unchecked state. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines two color values to be used in the application\\u0027s user interface.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Defines a color value of `#FF9FBBF3` to be used when the state is \\\"checked\\\".\\n2. Defines a color value of `#FFE6E8EB` to be used when the state is \\\"unchecked\\\".\\n\\nThis file is typically used in conjunction with other Android UI elements, such as checkboxes or radio buttons, to change the color of the element based on its checked/unchecked state.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/activity_media.xml\":\"This file is an XML layout file for an Android app. It defines a single `TextView` element within a `ConstraintLayout` that displays the text \\\"Media Library\\\" centered on the screen.\\n\\n`androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout`: A layout that allows views to be positioned based on constraints relative to other views and the parent layout.\\n\\n`TextView`: A view that displays text.\",\"/app/src/main/res/values-night/colors.xml\":\"This file appears to be an XML resource file, which is commonly used in Android development to store various types of resources, such as strings, colors, and styles. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather serves as a container for these types of resources.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a centralized location for storing and managing the resources used by an Android application. By separating the resources from the application code, it becomes easier to maintain and update the application, as well as to support different device configurations and languages.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/ic_no_results.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android vector drawable file, which defines a vector-based image that can be used in an Android application. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines several paths and shapes that make up the vector image. The image appears to be a logo or icon with a circular shape, a lightning bolt symbol, and some text. The file provides the necessary vector data to render this image at different sizes and resolutions on Android devices.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/licence.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an Android vector drawable resource that defines a path representing an arrow pointing to the left. The vector has a width of 8dp, a height of 14dp, and a viewport of 8x14. The path is filled with a color specified by the `@color/icons` resource. The `android:tintMode\\u003d\\\"multiply\\\"` attribute allows the vector to be tinted with a different color at runtime.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/practicum/playlistmaker/ExampleUnitTest.kt\":\"This file contains a single unit test class for the `PlaylistMaker` application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that verifies the correctness of the addition operation.\\n\\nThe file can be summarized as follows:\\n\\nThe `ExampleUnitTest` class is a JUnit test class that contains a single test method `addition_isCorrect()` which checks that the addition operation `2 + 2` returns the expected result of `4`.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/help.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android vector drawable file that defines a vector image. It does not contain any classes or functions. The file defines a vector image that appears to be a chat or messaging icon. The image includes various paths and shapes that make up the icon, including a main circular shape, two smaller circles representing chat bubbles, and a path representing a message or chat icon.\",\"/app/src/main/res/values/attrs.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an XML resource file that defines two custom attributes for an app theme:\\n\\n`AppTheme`: Defines custom attributes for an app theme, including the color of a clear icon and a right arrow.\\n\\n`clear_icon_color`: Defines the color of a clear icon in the app theme.\\n\\n`right_arrow_color`: Defines the color of a right arrow in the app theme.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/practicum/playlistmaker/ITunesService.kt\":\"This file defines an interface and a data class for interacting with the iTunes API.\\n\\n`ITunesService`: An interface that defines a method for searching for songs on the iTunes store.\\n\\n`searchSongs`: A function that sends a GET request to the iTunes search API with a search term and an optional entity type (in this case, \\\"song\\\").\\n\\n`ITunesSearchResponse`: A data class that represents the response from the iTunes search API, containing the total number of results and a list of `Track` objects.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/practicum/playlistmaker/MainActivity.kt\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `MainActivity` class and several functions related to the snowfall animation in a Kotlin-based Android application.\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity of the application, which sets up the user interface and handles the navigation to different activities.\\n\\n`startSnowfall()`: Starts the snowfall animation by repeatedly adding new snowflakes to the screen at a specified interval.\\n\\n`addSnowflake(screenWidth: Int, screenHeight: Int)`: Adds a new snowflake to the screen, sets its initial position, and starts the animation of the snowflake falling down the screen.\\n\\nThe file also includes the necessary imports and the implementation of the `onCreate()` function, which is the entry point of the `MainActivity` class.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/activity_settings.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file that defines the user interface for a settings screen. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the various UI elements and their layout constraints. Here\\u0027s a summary of the file:\\n\\n`androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout`: The main container that holds all the UI elements and defines their layout constraints.\\n`com.google.android.material.appbar.MaterialToolbar`: The top toolbar that displays the \\\"Settings\\\" title and a back navigation icon.\\n`androidx.appcompat.widget.SwitchCompat`: A switch button that allows the user to toggle the app\\u0027s theme.\\n`TextView`: Several text views that display the \\\"Share\\\", \\\"Help\\\", and \\\"License\\\" options.\\n`ImageButton`: Several image buttons that provide icons for the \\\"Share\\\", \\\"Help\\\", and \\\"License\\\" options.\\n\\nOverall, this file defines the layout and appearance of the settings screen, including the toolbar, theme switch, and various settings options.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/practicum/playlistmaker/ExampleInstrumentedTest.kt\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for the \\\"PlaylistMaker\\\" Android app. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that checks if the app\\u0027s package name matches the expected value.\\n\\n`ExampleInstrumentedTest`: This is an instrumented test class that runs on an Android device and tests the app\\u0027s context.\\n\\n`useAppContext()`: This test function checks if the app\\u0027s package name matches the expected value, which is \\\"com.practicum.playlistmaker\\\".\",\"/app/src/main/res/xml/data_extraction_rules.xml\":\"This file is an XML configuration file for data extraction rules in Android 12 backup and restore functionality. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather provides a template for configuring what data should be included or excluded from cloud backups and device transfers.\\n\\nThe file contains the following sections:\\n\\n`\\u003ccloud-backup\\u003e`: This section is used to configure what data should be included or excluded from cloud backups.\\n\\n`\\u003cdevice-transfer\\u003e`: This section is used to configure what data should be included or excluded from device transfers.\\n\\nThe file is intended to be customized by developers to control what data is backed up or transferred when using the Android 12 backup and restore functionality.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/arrow_right.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an Android vector drawable resource that defines a right-arrow icon. The vector drawable is defined with a `\\u003cvector\\u003e` element, which specifies the dimensions, viewport, and a `\\u003cpath\\u003e` element that defines the shape of the arrow.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/adjusts.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android vector drawable resource, which defines a vector graphic image. It does not contain any classes or functions. The vector graphic represents a settings or gear icon, with a circular shape and various paths and lines that form the icon\\u0027s design.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/practicum/playlistmaker/SettingsActivity.kt\":\"This file contains the implementation of the `SettingsActivity` class, which is responsible for handling the settings screen of the Playlist Maker application.\\n\\n`SettingsActivity`: This class represents the settings screen of the Playlist Maker application, allowing users to switch between light and dark themes, share the app, send support emails, and open the user agreement.\\n\\n`onCreate`: This function initializes the settings screen, sets up the toolbar, theme switch, and click listeners for the various buttons.\\n\\n`shareApp`: This function creates and starts an intent to share the Playlist Maker application with others.\\n\\n`sendSupportMail`: This function creates and starts an intent to open the user\\u0027s default email client with a pre-filled support email.\\n\\n`openUserLicence`: This function creates and starts an intent to open the user agreement URL in the user\\u0027s default web browser.\",\"/app/src/main/res/values-en/strings.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. It is an XML resource file that defines various string resources used in an Android application. The strings include labels for buttons, text fields, error messages, and other user interface elements. The file provides a centralized location for storing and managing the text content of the application, which can be useful for localization and internationalization purposes.\",\"/app/src/main/res/layout/activity_main.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML layout file that defines the user interface for a \\\"Playlist Maker\\\" application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the layout and appearance of the application\\u0027s main screen.\\n\\nThe main components of the layout are:\\n\\n`LinearLayout`: The main container for the layout, which is set to use the \\\"Base.Theme.PlaylistMaker\\\" theme and the \\\"ys_display_regular\\\" font family.\\n\\n`FrameLayout`: A container for the app\\u0027s title, which is displayed at the top of the screen.\\n\\n`TextView`: Displays the app\\u0027s title, \\\"Playlist Maker\\\", in a large font size.\\n\\n`LinearLayout`: A container for the main buttons of the app, which are arranged vertically.\\n\\n`MaterialButton`: Three buttons with icons, labeled \\\"Find\\\", \\\"Media\\\", and \\\"Adjusts\\\", which likely provide access to different features of the app.\\n\\n`FrameLayout`: A container for a \\\"snowflake\\\" element, which may be used for visual effects or animations.\\n\\nOverall, this file defines the basic structure and appearance of the Playlist Maker app\\u0027s main screen, including the app\\u0027s title, the main navigation buttons, and a placeholder for additional content.\",\"/app/src/main/res/values/styles.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android XML resource file that defines various styles and themes for a Playlist Maker application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the visual appearance and behavior of various UI elements in the app. Here\\u0027s a summary of the styles and themes defined in the file:\\n\\n`main_style`: Defines the default style for the main UI elements, such as the title text color, font, and size.\\n\\n`MessageTextStyle`: Defines the style for message text, including text alignment, color, size, and font.\\n\\n`MyAwesomeButton`: Defines the style for custom buttons, including layout, background color, text color, font, and other visual properties.\\n\\n`MyAwesomeSettingsButton`: Defines the style for settings buttons, including layout, background color, and font.\\n\\n`MyAwesomeSettingsTextView`: Defines the style for settings text views, including layout, background color, font, clickability, and text properties.\\n\\n`MyAwesomeToolbar`: Defines the style for the app\\u0027s toolbar, including background color, title text color, and switch properties.\\n\\n`Theme.PlaylistMaker`: Defines the light theme for the Playlist Maker app, including primary and secondary colors, and background color.\\n\\n`Theme.PlaylistMakerNight`: Defines the dark theme for the Playlist Maker app, including primary and secondary colors, and background color.\\n\\n`MyAwesomeEditText`: Defines the style for the search input field, including the drawable icon, padding, text size, hint, and background.\\n\\n`MyAwesomeTracker`: Defines the style for the track progress tracker, including text color and size.\\n\\n`MyTrackTitle`: Defines the style for the track title, including text size and color.\\n\\n`MyTrackInfo`: Defines the style for the track information (artist and duration), including text size and color.\\n\\n`MyAwesomeRoundedImage`: Defines the style for rounded images, including the corner radius.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/find_button.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android vector drawable file that defines a rectangular shape with rounded corners and some text content. The file does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines the visual appearance of a UI element.\\n\\nThe file defines the following elements:\\n\\n`\\u003cvector\\u003e`: Defines the overall vector drawable, including its dimensions and viewport.\\n`\\u003cpath\\u003e`: Defines the rectangular shape with rounded corners, filled with a white color.\\n`\\u003cpath\\u003e`: Defines the text content, which appears to be a search icon and some text.\\n\\nIn summary, this file defines the visual appearance of a UI element, likely a search bar or similar component, that can be used in an Android application.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android application called \\\"Playlist Maker\\\". It defines the project\\u0027s configuration, including the Android SDK version, dependencies, and build types. There are no explicit classes or functions defined in this file. Instead, it configures the build process for the Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/practicum/playlistmaker/MediaActivity.kt\":\"This file contains a single class:\\n\\n`MediaActivity`: This class represents the main activity of the Playlist Maker application, which is responsible for displaying the media-related content.\\n\\nThe file does not contain any functions, but it sets up the layout for the `MediaActivity` and enables the edge-to-edge feature for the activity.\",\"/app/src/main/res/drawable/error_image.xml\":\"This file appears to be an Android vector drawable resource, which is a vector-based image format used in Android applications. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines a vector graphic that can be used as an image asset in the application.\\n\\nThe vector graphic represents a square icon with rounded corners, containing a path that forms a stylized image. The path is filled with the color `#5f6368`, which is a grayish-blue color. The icon appears to be a generic file or document icon, with a series of lines and shapes that suggest the appearance of a document or file.\\n\\nThe vector drawable is defined with a `\\u003cvector\\u003e` element, which specifies the dimensions of the image (60dp by 60dp) and the viewport dimensions (960 by 960). The `\\u003cpath\\u003e` element within the `\\u003cvector\\u003e` defines the shape and appearance of the icon.\",\"/app/src/main/res/values-en/colors.xml\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Applies the Android application plugin to all sub-projects or modules.\\n2.
